The best husband/sons ever! My name is Sonya and about a year ago I stepped on a nail and fell down a flight of stairs and in a blink of an eye went from a normal woman married and in love to the same man for 26 yrs. with 2 sons 25 and 23 who are the biggest Falcons fans ever! Sadly because of all my procedures, they had to put cement into nine verta. so that I could live a somewhat normal life. My husband and I were both back in college getting our degrees when I had to quit because just the pain alone was to much to bare. Now I am slowly able to get out of the house, well actually we lost our home a few days ago because my husband had to take so much time off of work to care for me that now we are just living on hope and love. We lost everything and now my oldest son Jonathan has also put is life on hold so we could stay with him in is tiny apart. in Tampa. However in less than a year my husband will graduate and has decided that he will go ahead and go for is MA. and I am going to go back to college within a few months and finish getting my BA. I am telling you this story because when I seen how the NFL loves Levis just as we do I just knew that even though we have no more than 2 outfits each and if I could do anything to thank my husband and sons, I would take them to a Falcons game and make sure they were decked with some great levis but until that day comes. I just wanted to put this out there in cyberspace letting the world know I am humbled and proud of just how much they have given up just for me. I can't wait for the day that I will be able to pay it forward. Much love and Bless you all!

I know what size and shape I am. At least I thought I did till I went into the Levi store in Lincoln City. Tom and I entered the store and were greeted with a "can I help you?"  As Tom wandered off I said to the lady "yes, I bought this pair of jeans and I like them but forget what they are called, do you have them?" 
Without asking me any questions she answered "well I can tell you we probably don't have what you are looking for. The closest thing we have to a boyfriend cut is the 501. We don't carry anything for curvy girls here. I'm wearing the 501 right now and I don't have ANY curves" she then proceeded to walk around me once, even pulled the top of my jeans out in the back to look for elastic in the waist. All of this in the middle of the store room floor in front of every customer. 
She then said something about buying jeans with stretch and something about another store that honestly I don't remember because at this point I was like I deer in headlights. 
It was then my darling husband turned around from the corner he was in and looked at my face. Walking towards me as the woman asked is there anything else she could help me with. "No, I think I'll just go." I said and started for the door. Tom asked me what was wrong. I told him "they don't have anything for curvy girls" and we left. I spent the next 20 min in a complete daze! Something like this has never happened to me before. I'm still not quite sure what to make of it. That woman never asked me what size I am or anything. It almost ruined my shopping for the day. But I needed jeans really bad as I was down to one pair. So I finally went to old navy and got myself some curvy girl size 12s. Thank GOD there is at least one store who's manufacturers carry enough bolts and bolts of fabric to cover my enormous ASS!

Dear Dockers,

I am writing to share my less than ideal experience at one of your stores in 1 Utama mall. I purchased a Dockers Premium Edition Alpha Khaki from the store and left it in your capable hands to alter it.

When I returned to pick up my Khaki, I was surprised to see that the store had used a thread of a completely different colour, and the stitching was substandard.

I expressed my displeasure to the girls at the store. One of the girls who attended to my concern was disinterested in listening to what I had to say. Instead, she mentioned that everyone in Malaysia knows that this is the kind of stitching people get when they get trousers altered. I would like to point out here that I have had a better experience getting my pants altered at a local shop. And I expected even better experience from an international brand.

When I asked about the colour of the thread, she mentioned that the store received the trousers today, and they haven‚Äôt had the chance to get the thread of the correct colour, and this is the best they can do. I guess she did not think that it was necessary to inform me when I asked her to alter the Khakis. When I insisted, she came back with a couple of options with an expectation that I‚Äôll instruct her which colour to use. I did not think it was my job to suggest the colour of the thread.

I politely asked for an exchange since they were unable to rectify my problem. However, my request was declined by portraying that it was my error that I didn‚Äôt know either of the things. Supervisor was less than helpful too. I think they got away because I am not local (I am from New Zealand) and did not raise my voice at them.

The people at the store were unapologetic for what they did to me. I will urge to people to avoid shopping at Dockers 1 Utama.

I hope that you, Dockers, would listen to me as a customer and not avoid me like people at the store. I expect that someone from your company will rectify my problem.

Thanks and Kind Regards,
Vivek

Just wanted to voice this: I recently bought some new Levi's jeans. The curve ID line have been my go to for years. They were the only jeans that wouldn't do that gapping thing in the back plus they were high quality cotton with just a touch of elastic so they really lasted and wore in beautifully. It's been two years since my last denim purchase and I was sad to see they have been discontinued. I did however purchase two pair of the 711 skinnies and one pair of the 501 cts. The 501s are great! 100% cotton, super comfy yet durable and cool feeling. The 711s however are awful. I didn't realize they had such a high amount of polyester in them. They feel like I'm wearing stretch pants and have an immediate hot and itchy feeling that cotton denim does not have. I regret purchasing them and will return them. This is so disappointing because Levi's were like the last good quality affordable jeans for women out there. I know your men's jeans are still the same as always, so why do clothing companies continue to downgrade the quality of only women's apparel?!? Women want good quality comfortable lasting clothes as well. Maybe I am in the minority on that, but I just thought you should hear one long time customer's opinion. I hope you return to making high quality women's clothing across the board again in the future.

I had the website pulled up told the customer service agent that I could add them to my cart and Levis online showed them in stock. The customer service agent told me just reorder them and I would have to call back with my order number to have the price adjusted.

The 2nd person I talked to said since I used a 20% off coupon my 2nd order (to limited the pending charge amount on my card) that she would take an addition 15% after the initial 20%. I told her that "x" amount of dollars minus 15% then minus 20% separately did not total 35%. Anyone with a basic understanding of mathematics would understand that. I asked why she couldn't just match the prices of the items and she just repeated she would take an additional 15% off the initial 20%... I told her I would just cancel the order and reorder it with no coupon.

The 3rd person I talked to said they would issue a refund in the difference of what I initially paid vs what I paid for the reorder. I then waited a few days to see the refunded amount.

I noticed I was shorted just over $28 on the refunded amount a few days later so I called back.

Anyways I explained that I was shorted on my refunded amount and that I would like the difference returned back on my credit card. After a long hold and many corrections on basic math (adding, subtracting and percentages) I was told that the refund would be expected in the next 3-5 business days.

After waiting a week I called Levis back today and asked why my refund was talking so long. It appears that the last rep that was so "experienced" hadn't left any notes and further more, did not even put in for a refund. The Levis representative I spoke with was helpful but very rude. After the hold she asked for more information on the 1st order that I was matching and I gave her the order number. I asked her if I could give her the figures on what I paid the 1st time, what I paid the 2nd time, and the first refund so that she can calculate the difference to be refunded. She said she would do it her self and was putting me on another hold. After another hold the Levis representative said a refund of $7 would be applied. I told her that the refund was supposed to be $28. I then offered to give her the figures again which she listened to. As a citizen of North Carolina, I am writing to express my displeasure at your opposition to North Carolina‚Äôs HB2 law, specifically your clearly insincere political posturing.  You, along with dozens of other companies signed a letter with the Human Rights Campaign and Equality NC expressing your opposition to the law.  Several of the companies on that letter also have either reversed plans to expand into North Carolina, or threatened to stop doing business here because of HB2.To all of you, I ask this: have you even read the law as it was written?  You say in the letter that ‚ÄúHB 2 is not a bill that reflects the values of our companies, of our country, or even the overwhelming majority of North Carolinians.‚Äù  Therefore, I would have to surmise that the values of your company include trampling the rights and safety of the many in order to curry favor with a vocal but in reality tiny minority. I say you are clearly posturing and trying to curry favor for several reasons. Allow me to exemplify one with this question if you genuinely believe in nondiscrimination for all people regardless of race, sex, religion or gender identity, then how long have you had gender neutral bathrooms in your place of business? You claim you are standing up for transgendered individuals.  The fact of the matter is, transgender individuals make up only .3 percent of the US population.  Therefore, the majority of your customers are from the 99.7% of Americans.  It is the money of the 99.7% that keeps your company in business.  I feel betrayed by your urgency to be politically correct, rather than remaining loyal to the families that support your business.  You are not standing up for the majority of your loyal customers. Again, in the letter, you say you pride yourself on being ‚Äúinclusive and welcoming to all.‚Äù  Your opposition to HB2 and bullying the NC legislature with threats does not feel welcoming or inclusive at all. HB2 came to be in order to ensure protection for women and children from potential sexual predators. Charlotte‚Äôs city council ordinance would have allowed biological males to share the same restroom, locker and shower facilities as women and children. As a woman and mother, I find the accommodation that puts my safety and my teenage daughter‚Äôs safety at risk for the sake of political correctness appalling.I would also warn you to be careful that the tactics you use to bully the state in which I live may be turned against your company when you get on the wrong side of the runaway train of political correctness.Shame on you to those of companies who have threatened to or actually pulled business out of NC.  You say you are doing so because of your deeply held beliefs. You have the freedom to do that, thanks to the laws in place in NC.  That right is the exact one HB2 wants to ensure. I encourage you to rethink your stance on this issue, and understand that in this great country in which we live and do business, people can coexist and still hold differing opinions on various issues.

I was told they were looking into it and I would be contacted in 3 - 5 business days.  Nothing.  I followed up and recieved a snotty email telling me that they already told me there was a problem, but they'd let me know once they figured it out.  Finally, 3 weeks after I placed the order I followed up yet again only to be told my order was cancelled, but for all my trouble I'd get free shipping on my NEXT order (recall I already had free shipping on this order), as if I'd ever order from them again.  I responded and asked if my money had been refunded and asked why it took them 3 weeks to tell me that THEY cancelled my order.  I recieved an email telling me someone would get back to me in 24 hours.  I never heard back from them.  I was never rude in any of my emails to Levis.com.  I really don't understand why they just didn't fill my order and apologize to me.

Ordered a Levi's Trucker Jacket online to replace one I've had for at least 10 years. Loved the old one, but it's finally starting to fall apart. Found a good price online with free shipping, so I ordered it. Problem is two-fold. First, the new jacket just doesn't fit right. Same size as my old one, but the cut is very different. Fits shoulders and waist and length is fine, but very tight across chest and sleeves are very tight. It's just unwearable and I doubt that the next size would fit either. And that's ok, but the other problem is that I have to pay $7.50 to return the package. This just doesn't seem fair. Luckily, I had free shipping, because if I had paid for shipping your policy is not to refund that either. So in the worst case I would pay $15 to try a jacket that doesn't fit. I'm unwilling to order another size because you won't do an exchange and with a new order I risk more shipping charges if it doesn't fit. This is not a fair policy for selling clothing online! I am completely disappointed with the Levi's online store and cannot recommend it.
